description:
The Algebra 1 course, often taught in the 9th grade, covers Linear equations, inequalities, functions, and graphs; Systems of equations and inequalities; Extension of the concept of a function; Exponential models; and Quadratic equations, functions, and graphs. Khan Academy's Algebra 1 course is built to deliver a comprehensive, illuminating, engaging, and Common Core aligned experience!  

**Teaching this course? Check out our [teacher resources](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/algebra/x2f8bb11595b61c86:alg1-ccss-teacher-resources)!**
subject: algebra
title: Algebra 1

units.description:
Why did humans invent algebra in the first place? Let's look at the history and beauty of algebra, and review some fundamental ideas and tools we'll use throughout the course.  

 **Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/40mzAy7)

units.description:
There are lots of strategies we can use to solve equations. Let's explore some different ways to solve equations and inequalities. We'll also see what it takes for an equation to have no solution, or infinite solutions.  

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/3BWY5b6)

units.description:
If you are in the United States, you might see a car with a fuel efficiency rating of 50 miles per gallon. Somewhere else, you'd probably see it called 4.7 liters per 100 kilometers. Let's practice solving real world problems like this involving units!  

 **Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/3YqMuJ6)

units.title: Working with units

units.description:

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/4elou01)

units.description:
We can write linear equations in different forms to reveal different features of the scenarios they describe. Let's get clever.  

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/4e2hWD7)

units.description:
If one line is useful, let's see what we can do with two lines. In this unit, we learn how to write systems of equations, solve those systems, and interpret what those solutions mean in a real-world context.  

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/4hrPk9e)

units.description:
If it takes someone in a cooking competition 30 seconds to chop an onion and 18 seconds to chop a carrot, and their goal is to chop at least 20 of these vegetables in a time limit of 540 seconds, what can they do? Use a system of linear inequalities, of course.  

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/3NHzqdg)

units.description:
A function is like a machine that takes an input and gives an output. Let's explore how we can graph, analyze, and create different types of functions.  

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/4fqqpRR)

units.title: Functions

units.description:
Sequences are a special type of function that are useful for describing patterns. In this unit, we'll see how sequences let us jump forwards or backwards in patterns to solve problems.

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/3AOkrLO)

units.description:
Piecewise functions piece together different functions. Absolute value graphs make a V shape, but why do they do that? Let's explore how to make some new and interesting types of graphs.

**Unit guides are here!**  Power up your classroom with engaging strategies, tools, and activities from Khan Academy’s learning experts. [**PDF**](https://bit.ly/48XflJR)

units.description: Let's review exponent rules and level up what we know about roots. The square root is nice, but let's learn about higher-order roots like the cube root (or 3rd root).

units.description: We can factor numbers like 24 into 2x12, or 3x8, or 4x6...But how can we factor algebraic expressions? We'll see that it's a lot like a puzzle.

units.description: We've seen linear and exponential functions, and now we're ready for quadratic functions. We'll explore how these functions and the parabolas they produce can be used to solve real-world problems.

units.description: We sat down with some experts to ask them questions like, "Why is creativity important in algebra?" Let's see what they had to say!
units.title: Creativity in algebra

units.description: Getting ready to teach Algebra 1? You’ll want Khan Academy’s unit guides in your toolkit. Developed by our learning experts, each guide includes student misconceptions, top teaching strategies, and step-by-step suggestions to help you support your students’ success.
units.title: Teacher resources
